FuncDef:
The radius-server nas-port-id include command configures the format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute sent by a non-LNS device to the RADIUS server.
The undo radius-server nas-port-id command deletes the configured format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute sent by a non-LNS device to the RADIUS server.
By default, the device retains the format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute to be sent to the RADIUS server.
CLIs: radius-server nas-port-id include [ delimiter <delimiter-val> ] { interface-description [ delimiter <int-delimiter-val> ] | pe-vlan [ delimiter <pevlan-delimiter-val> ] | ce-vlan [ delimiter <cevlan-delimiter-val> ] } *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a delimiter.
The value is b, *, -, \, #, $, @, &, :.

Indicates the description of an interface.
-

Indicates the inner VLAN ID of a user.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI-radius-test2] radius-server nas-port-id include interface-description delimiter - pe-vlan delimiter - ce-vlan delimiter -
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the RADIUS server has special requirements on the format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute, run the radius-server nas-port-id lns or radius-server nas-port-id command to configure the format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute as required.
Configuration Impact
If the radius-server nas-port-id lns or radius-server nas-port-id command is run more than once in the same view, the latest configuration overrides the previous one. After the radius-server nas-port-id lns or radius-server nas-port-id command is run, the NAS-Port-Id attribute is sent to the RADIUS server in the configured format.
